question: Who is known as the 'Father of Economics'?

options: Government ownership of the means of production

question: Who is the author of 'Das Kapital'?

options: Government ownership of the means of production
Private ownership of the means of production

question: Who is the author of 'The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money'?

The economy should be left to the private sector

options: Government spending should be increased in a recession

The economy should be left to the private sector

options: Government spending should be increased in a recession
The economy will always return to full employment on its own

The economy should be left to the private sector

options: Government ownership of the means of production

question: Who is the author of 'The Road to Serfdom'?

question: Who is the author of 'The Affluent Society'?

The economy should be left to the private sector

question: Who is the author of 'The Shock Doctrine'?

Inflation and unemployment are negatively correlated

Price is determined by the government

options: An increase in spending will lead to a smaller increase in output
An increase in spending will lead to a larger increase in output

An increase in spending will lead to a decrease in output

options: The economy grows steadily over time
The economy experiences regular fluctuations in output and employment

The economy is always in a state of recession

options: Tax cuts will always lead to a decrease in revenue
Tax increases will always lead to an increase in revenue

Taxes have no effect on revenue

Population growth is the main driver of economic growth

Government spending is the main driver of economic growth

Tax cuts can stimulate economic growth
Government debt has no effect on private savings
Government debt can crowd out private investment

The economy will always return to full employment on its own

An increase in spending will lead to a decrease in output

Real variables and nominal variables are unrelated
